brief_summary.textblock: Ineffective hemostasis or a paradoxical prothrombotic state of Acute-on-chronic liver disease (ACLF) has been well established. Thrombelastography measures the dynamics of thrombin production and provides a global assessment of coagulation incorporating the cumulative effect of the interactions at various levels between plasma components and cellular component of coagulation. And through the platelet mapping, it can help provide a picture of patients' function of platelet. Based on the primary result of our derivation cohort(NCT03281278), ACLF patients with high ADP inhibition rate had high 28-day mortality.This multicenter validation cohort aims to validate the predictive role of platelet mapping in ACLF prognosis, organ failure developments and short term mortality.

study_pop.textblock: Patients with ACLF regardless of aetiology, International Normalized Ratio (INR)≥1.5 and total bilirubin≥85μmol/L
